intro: Megalastrum lasiernos, commonly known as the roughleaf megalastrum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves that are covered in coarse, stinging hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
